name: myScoop Rank Tracker
author: Nick Duncan

sections.description:
This plugin connects directly to myScoop and pulls information regarding your blog. The information is then stored in a data file on your server and only updated once a day to ensure quick loading times. You can now display either a graph of your rank history, or a big rank button.

Arbitrary section

This plugin connects directly to myScoop and pulls information regarding your blog. The information is then stored in a data file on your server and only updated once a day to ensure quick loading times. Currently the only way to display your rank history is by use of a graph. More options will be made available soon.

A brief Markdown Example

Ordered list:

  1. myScoop Rank Display

Unordered list:

  • myScoop Rank Display
sections.installation:
1. Upload myscoop-rank.php and the sub directories to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Place the ‘myScoop Rank Tracker’ widget into one of your sidebars
  4. Input the information required in the widget
sections.faq:
Can someone display my stats on their blog?

No, I have put strict security measures in place with this plugin. myScoop will double check that the original location of the request is matched to the blog ID that you specify. If not, the information will not be sent.
sections.changelog:
1.3

  • You can now either display a graph, or a big rank button

1.2

  • Added some more functionality to the widget control panel

1.1

  • Graph now displays inverted rankings (if the graph data line goes down, your ranking is geting worse)
  • You can now change the background color of the graph in the widget control panel

1.0

  • First release
